page.title: 04Dartford Heath
page.content:
Dartford Heath, now split by the A2, Dartford bypass, is on a gravelly terrace of the River Thames, and is clothed with small trees such as Hawthorn, Sallow and Silver Birch. Shrubs like Gorse, Broom and Brambles abound-interspread with grasses and wild flowers. Open areas have been made over to cricket and football pitches. Local people can find something to interest them at every season. It is an ornithologists paradise-but bird spotters are no longer likely to see the rare Dartford Warbler whose last sronghold is now only on the S.Coast. Sadly children are not encouraged to play alone on the heath. Heath fires are now common place on the heath.
by Janet Lee.
